How to push notifications from dashboard?

Very handy way to push notifications.

1 minute read

While mostly you'll use API to push notifications, pushing from dashboard might be required to do one-time notifications or when testing and developing.

We're assuming that you've got the JS widget (Horntell Center) integrated in your webpage.

  1. If you log in your Horntell account, you will see one profile that got created when you got your Horntell Center integrated in your webpage. Did you see it?

  2. There are three buttons below each profile, but weâ€™ll focus on just the first one for now. Hit the and a small window will pop up.

  3. To simply try out how notifications are pushed, we'll ignore everything for now in the small window and simply paste this in the input field: "Does this really work? Oh god, this does work!".

  4. Hit Send.

  5. Open the webpage where your widget was integrate and voila, did you see something? So this does actually work. :)

While it was very interesting to send our first (and simple) notification, we highly recommend you to know more about various formats notifications to make most out of them.

Horntell allows websites to push Interactive Notifications to their users.

Fastest way to get in touch? Twitter (@horntell).

If this article couldn't answer your question still, feel free to write to your friends at Horntell: friends@horntell.com.
